meanings.definition: To place or set after in time or order.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his breakfast, he will postpose his morning walk.
meanings.sent2: She always postposes her dentist appointments to the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to postpose gathering nuts until after the rain stopped.
meanings.sent4: The teacher postposed the quiz to give students more time to study.
meanings.sent5: The runner postposed crossing the finish line to help a fellow competitor.

meanings.sent1: They will postpose the meeting until next week.
meanings.sent2: He tends to postpose making important decisions until the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to postpose bath time by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to postpose the product launch due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent5: She had to postpose her vacation due to unexpected work commitments.
